Understate: The claim understates the fact that Biden has paid money into retirement funds that are invested in the stock market.
Falters at times: The claim falters by stating that Biden has never had a savings account, when in fact he has possessed savings accounts.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or sources to back up the statement that Biden has never owned stocks or bonds.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that Biden's lack of direct ownership of stocks or bonds means he has never had any financial involvement in the stock market.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that while Biden may not have direct ownership of stocks or bonds, he may have indirect investments or financial interests tied to the stock market.
